Updated 3 dead in Brampton house fire, 1 girl taken to hospital with serious burns Peel police got the call shortly after 4 a.m. for townhouse near Dixie Road and Bovaird Drive East By Lauren Pelley, CBC News Posted: Feb 14, 2017 5:49 AM ET Last Updated: Feb 14, 2017 6:40 AM ET Firefighters battle the blaze at the Brampton, Ont., townhouse where three people died overnight. (Brampton Fire/Twitter) 
Three people have died in an overnight house fire in Brampton, Ont. 
Peel Regional Police were called shortly after 4 a.m. about a fire at the townhouse on Madison Street, near Dixie Road and Bovaird Drive East. 
Police said a young girl was also taken to the Hospital for Sick Children with third-degree burns and smoke inhalation. 
"It's tragic, certainly â€” the number of people who have died here," said Brampton fire Chief Michael Clark, who was at the scene Tuesday morning. 
Fire is under control at Madison St.All crews remain committed ^pb pic.twitter.com/pTc5ilaqAu 
The fire started on the main floor. It took fire crews about 10 minutes to get it under control, Clark said. 
The relationship between the three people who died and the young girl isn't clear, he said. 
People in the neighbouring townhouses are safe, police said. 
#PRP onscene of serious house fire on Madison St, B. Fire contained to one unit, area shut down. Media officers heading to scene. Avoid area pic.twitter.com/tMms3QThd2 
Emergency services remained at the scene of the fire Tuesday morning, and are awaiting the arrival of the coroner and someone from the Office of the Ontario Fire Marshal. 
Cause of the fire is being investigated. With files from Linda Ward
